                            Home / Research                         Institutional Research                                                             Institutional Research                       The Office of Assessment and Institutional Research (AIR) is committed to enhancing the educational, research, and workplace experience at NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering. The core function of AIR is to serve the School of Engineering community by providing objective, research-based information and analysis to support decision-making, planning, evaluation, and performance improvement.   In support of AIR’s core function, the office also serves as the School of Engineering's primary source for all federal and state data, for coordination of accreditation processes, in addition to providing the information for all external surveys and maintaining a wide array of dynamic databases to support longitudinal studies and statistical analysis. AIR supports the school’s overall performance measurement and assessment activities of its academic and administrative departments by collaborating with other offices to insure the integrity and usability of its data and information resources.
